data.title: Clinical Resources: A-Z
data.text:
“Warning! Expensive Vaccine in Storage!” Sign

Sign to post near circuit breaker (portrait and landscape versions).

#P2091

Language: English, Spanish

Additional Travel Vaccine Standing Orders (Military Health System)

Access sample standing orders protocols for Japanese encephalitis, rabies, typhoid, yellow fever, and other vaccines from the Military Health System.

Partner Resource

Language: English

Addressing Vaccination Anxiety for Children Strategies for Healthcare Professionals

Immunize.org’s 1-page handout, designed for healthcare personnel, describes strategies that can be followed before, during, and after the vaccination visit to improve the vaccination experience for children. Several useful resources are also listed

#P4271

Language: English

Addressing Vaccination Anxiety for Children Strategies for Vaccine Recipients and Caregivers

This 1-page handout, designed for vaccine recipients and caregivers, describes strategies that can be followed before, during, and after the vaccination visit to improve the vaccination experience for children. Several useful resources are also listed.

#P4271a

Language: English

Also available in:

Spanish

Addressing Vaccination Anxiety for Infants and Toddlers Strategies for Healthcare Professionals

Immunize.org’s 1-page handout, designed for healthcare personnel, describes strategies that can be followed before, during, and after the vaccination visit to improve the vaccination experience for infants and toddlers. Several useful resources are also listed

#P4272

Language: English

Addressing Vaccination Anxiety for Infants and Toddlers Strategies for Parents and Caregivers

This 1-page handout, designed for parents and caregivers, describes strategies that can be followed before, during, and after the vaccination visit to improve the vaccination experience for infants and toddlers. Several useful resources are also listed.

#P4272a

Language: English

Also available in:

Spanish

Addressing Vaccination Anxiety in Adolescents and Adults: Strategies for Healthcare Professionals

Immunize.org’s 1-page handout, designed for healthcare personnel, describes strategies that can be followed before, during, and after the vaccination visit to improve the vaccination experience for adolescents and adults. Several useful resources are also listed

#P4270

Language: English

Addressing Vaccination Anxiety in Adolescents and Adults: Strategies for Vaccine Recipients and Caregivers

This 1-page handout, designed for vaccine recipients and caregivers, describes strategies that can be followed before, during, and after the vaccination visit to improve the vaccination experience for adolescents and adults. Several useful resources are also listed

#P4270a

Language: English

Also available in:

Spanish

Administering Vaccines to Adults: Dose, Route, Site, and Needle Size

One-page reference table.

#P3084

Language: English

Administering Vaccines: Dose, Route, Site, and Needle Size

One-page reference table.

#P3085

Language: English

Adult Immunization: Importance of Staying Up to Date With Vaccines

This fact sheet describes the reasons why it’s important that adults stay up to date with their vaccinations.

#P4033

Language: English

After the Shots ... What To Do if Your Child Has Discomfort

Tip sheet for parents describing how to reduce fever, including medication dosages for various ages and weights of children.

Before You Vaccinate Adults, Consider Their “H-A-L-O”!

Use this easy-to-use chart to help you make an initial decision about vaccinating a patient.

#P3070

Language: English

COVID-19 Moderna Updated (2023–2024 Formula) Vaccine – 5 Years of Age and Older (Age 5 Through 11 Yrs – Dark Blue Cap/Green Label; Age 12+ Yrs – Dark Blue Cap/Blue Label and Manufacturer-filled Syringe)

CDC’s form: “Updated (2023–2024 Formula) Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine: Standing Orders for Administering Vaccine – 5 Years of Age and Older”

Partner Resource

CDC CS321570-AB

Language: English

Checklist for Safe Vaccine Storage and Handling

More than 30 important things you can do to safeguard your vaccine supply.

#P3035

Language: English

Checklist of Current Versions of U.S. COVID-19 Vaccination Guidance and Clinic Support Tools

Checklist of links to key COVID-19 vaccination resources, including the date they were last revised. Updated at least monthly.

#P3130

Language: English

Clear Answers and Smart Advice About Your Baby’s Shots

Written by Dr. Ari Brown, clear answers to parents’ questions about vaccines.

#P2068

Language: English

Russian

Communicating the Benefits of Influenza Vaccination

Tips to assist healthcare professionals with communicating the benefits of influenza vaccination.

#P3115

Language: English

DTaP, Tdap, and Td Catch-Up Vaccination Recommendations by Prior Vaccine History and Age

This table summarizes the catch-up recommendations of CDC’s ACIP for the use of DTaP, Tdap, and Td vaccines.

#P2055

Language: English

Dates of Current Vaccine Information Statements (VISs)

Print and cut out up to four charts (4″ x 5.5″) of current VIS dates for posting around the clinic and workplace.

#P2029

Language: English

Declination of Influenza Vaccination

Form for healthcare worker signature and date, lists important reasons for annual influenza vaccination and consequences of vaccine refusal

#P4068

Language: English

Diphtheria: Questions and Answers

Information about the disease and vaccines for patients and parents

#P4203

Language: English

Don’t Be Guilty of These Preventable Errors in Vaccine Administration!

This 4-page document describes common errors in vaccine administration and provides links to resources that can help prevent them

#P3033

Language: English

Don't take Chances with Your Family's Health — Make Sure You All Get Vaccinated

Give this piece to patients/parents to inform them about influenza vaccine

#P4069

Language: English

Don’t Be Guilty of These Preventable Errors in Vaccine Storage and Handling!

This 2-page document describes common errors in vaccine storage and handling and provides links to resources that can help prevent them

#P3036

Language: English

Evidence Shows Vaccines Unrelated to Autism

Co-authored with the Autism Science Foundation, this handout explains to parents why experts say vaccines do not cause autism

#P4028

Language: English

Fainting Related to Vaccination: What You Need to Know

A 1-page handout for patients and caregivers describes symptoms of fainting (syncope), how it can occur around vaccination, how to reduce the risk of vaccination-related fainting, and what to do if someone faints during vaccination

#P4260a

Language: English

Also available in:

Spanish

Great Resources on Give2MenACWY.org to Help You Increase Teen Vaccination & MenACWY Booster Dose Rates

Learn about vaccination resources to help increase second dose MenACWY coverage at 16 years of age

#U2018

Language: English

Guidance for Developing Admission Orders in Labor & Delivery and Newborn Units to Prevent Hepatitis B Virus Transmission

For HBsAg screening in labor and delivery units and hepatitis B immunization in newborn nurseries

#P2130

Language: English

Guide for Determining the Number of Doses of Influenza Vaccine to Give to Children Age 6 Months Through 8 Years

This resource provides guides for determining the number of doses of influenza vaccine to give to children ages 6 months through 8 years

#P3093

Language: English

HPV Vaccine: A Guide for Adults Ages 18-26 Years

One-page handout provides answers to common questions about HPV and HPV vaccination

#P4251

Language: English

Also available in:

Spanish

Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib): Questions and Answers

Information about the disease and vaccines for patients and parents

#P4206

Language: English

Healthcare Personnel Vaccination Recommendations

Recommendations in brief for healthcare personnel vaccinations.

#P2017

Language: English

Hepatitis A Is a Serious Liver Disease: Vaccination Can Protect You!

Handout for all ages

#P4080

Language: English

Hepatitis A and Hepatitis B Vaccines: Be Sure Your Patients Get the Correct Dose

Recommended child and adult dosages of licensed hepatitis A and B vaccines

#P2081

Language: English

Hepatitis A, B, and C: Learn the Differences

One-page table explaining the differences

#P4075

Language: English

Hepatitis A: Questions and Answers

Information about the disease and vaccines for patients and parents

#P4204

Language: English

Hepatitis B Birth Dose Honor Roll Application

Print-ready application form for the Birth Dose Honor Roll

#P2208

Language: English

Hepatitis B Facts: Testing and Vaccination

List of people who should receive hepatitis b vaccination, answers to questions about hepatitis b screening or serologic testing, interpretation of the hepatitis B panel, and a glossary of hepatitis B terminology.

#P2110

Language: English

Hepatitis B Vaccination and Screening of Adults: Simple Steps to Protect Yourself from Serious Liver Disease

The one-page printable resource to share with adult patients. Describes the CDC-recommended triple panel blood screening test for hepatitis B and the need for hepatitis b vaccination for all adults

#P4085

Language: English

Hepatitis B and Healthcare Personnel

Answers to questions about protecting healthcare personnel from hepatitis b including vaccination and booster recommendations, post-exposure prophylaxis guidelines, hepatitis b triple panel screening, and frequency of hepatitis b testing.

#P2109

Language: English

Hepatitis B: Questions & Answers

Information about the disease and vaccines for patients and parents

#P4205

Language: English

How To Administer Intramuscular and Intranasal Influenza Vaccines

This piece is for providers and shows how to administer intramuscular and intranasal influenza vaccines.

#P2024

Language: English

How To Administer Intramuscular and Subcutaneous Vaccine Injections

Two-sided information sheet with illustrations.

#P2020

Language: English

How To Administer Intramuscular and Subcutaneous Vaccine Injections to Adults

One-page information sheet with illustrations.

#P2020A

Language: English

How To Administer Multiple Intramuscular Vaccines to Adults During One Visit

One-page information sheet with illustrations.

#P2030

Language: English

How to Administer Intranasal and Oral Vaccinations

This piece, for providers, shows how to administer intranasal and oral vaccinations.

#P2021

Language: English

Two-page handout provides answers to common questions about HPV and HPV vaccination

Information about the disease and vaccines for patients and parents

Picture of the shot schedule

Implementing Hepatitis B Universal Adult Screening and Vaccination: Clinical Answers for Healthcare Professionals

A three-page printable clinical resource to answer common questions about the implementation of adult hepatitis B screening and vaccination guidelines for adult patients and healthcare workers

#P2080

Influenza Vaccine Products for the 2023-2024 Influenza Season

Information about influenza vaccine products available in the U.S. during 2023-2024

Language: English

Influenza: Questions and Answers

Information about the disease and vaccines for patients and parents

#P4208

Key Vaccination Resources for Healthcare Professionals

Annotated list of key training, education, and reference materials for people who vaccinate or oversee vaccination clinics

#P2005

Language: English

Labor & Delivery HBsAg Admission Checklist for Birthing Mother

This checklist is for labor and delivery HBsAg admission for the birthing mother

#P2225

Language: English

Leading Medical Organizations Endorse Strong School and Childcare Vaccination Requirements and Elimination of Non-Medical Exemptions

One-page handout for policymakers listing medical organizations’ policies that endorse childcare and school vaccination requirements and the elimination of personal belief and religious exemptions

#P2071

Language: English

MMR Vaccine Does Not Cause Autism—Examine the Evidence!

These articles are provided for parents and practitioners to compare the balance of evidence.

#P4026

Language: English

Maintaining the cold chain during transport

Immunize.org is no longer distributing this piece. For an excellent resource on this subject, see the California Department of Public Health’s “Transporting Refrigerated Vaccines”

Language: English
